title: NYPD Officer Killed in NYC Shooting Was Part of Paid Detail Unit
summary: The Paid Detail Unit allows businesses that can afford it to pay for extra police protection.

title: What We Know about the NYC Shooting in Midtown Manhattan
summary: Four people were killed, including an off-duty New York City police officer, when a gunman opened fire in an office tower before fatally shooting himself, officials said.

title: Former Football Players With CTE Have Turned to Violence
summary: The gunman in the Manhattan office shooting said in a note that he believed he had C.T.E., a degenerative disease linked by studies to repeated hits to the head.

title: Trump Is Winning His Trade War. What Will That Mean for the Economy?
summary: The president’s vision for reshaping global trade is falling into place, but he is embarking on an experiment that economists say could still produce damaging results.

title: I.M.F. Raises Global Growth Outlook as U.S. Eases Some Tariffs
summary: The International Monetary Fund warned that trade tension continued to be a risk for the global economy.

title: Trump’s E.U. Trade Deal Comes With Impossible Energy Promises
summary: The European Union pledged to buy billions of dollars’ worth of energy resources from the United States. Experts say that’s unrealistic and could hurt Europe’s climate goals.

title: Marjorie Taylor Greene Is First Republican Lawmaker to Call Gaza Crisis a ‘Genocide’
summary: Ms. Greene is the first Republican in Congress to use the term to describe the dire humanitarian situation in Gaza, two years after she led the push to censure a Democrat for speaking out against conditions there.

title: UK Will Recognize Palestinian Statehood In September, Unless Israel-Hamas Cease-Fire is Reached
summary: Prime Minister Keir Starmer said his country would act unless there was a truce, citing the “intolerable” humanitarian crisis in Gaza.

title: Israeli Settler Kills Palestinian Activist Included in Oscar-Winning Documentary
summary: Awdah Hathaleen, whose work was featured in the Oscar-winning documentary “No Other Land,” was shot dead. The suspect had been subject to U.S. sanctions, but President Trump lifted them.

title: Israeli Far-Right Minister Promotes Plan for Jewish Resettlement in Gaza
summary: Bezalel Smotrich described Gaza as an ‘inseparable part’ of Israel, even as the Netherlands announced a ban on him and another hard line Israeli minister.

title: E.P.A. Plans to Revoke the Legal Basis for Tackling Climate Change
summary: The agency’s administrator said in a podcast that the move would be “the largest deregulatory action in the history of America.”

title: Coal Plants Emailed the E.P.A. to Avoid Clean-Air Rules
summary: Sites including at least 15 coal plants sought exemptions from environmental rules using a new Trump administration system to fast-track requests, documents show.

title: The First Soda in Space: When NASA Got Caught Up in the Cola Wars
summary: In the summer of 1985, NASA, the Reagan White House and seven talented astronauts were wrangled into an orbital battle over soft-drink supremacy.

title: How Europe’s Leaders Coaxed Trump on Gaza and Ukraine
summary: A tactic of deference and praise, along with a studied attempt to avoid any public blowups, coaxed President Trump into changes on key issues like Gaza and Ukraine.

title: Justice Dept. Seeks Censure of Judge Boasberg, Widening Fight With Judiciary
summary: A complaint said Judge James E. Boasberg, who has clashed with the Trump administration over deportation plans, made “improper public comments” about President Trump in a closed-door judicial conference.

title: Powell Under Siege as Fed Plans to Stand Pat on Rate Cuts
summary: Jerome H. Powell, the Federal Reserve chair, is facing relentless attacks from the president, a lively campaign to replace him and divisions in his own ranks over when to cut interest rates.

title: Shoppers Embrace ‘Christmas in July’ Amid Rising Costs and Tariff Limbo
summary: People are starting their holiday shopping earlier this year, using summer sales from retailers like Amazon and Walmart to save time and money.

title: Union Pacific to Buy Norfolk Southern in $85 Billion Railroad Deal
summary: The merger would create the United States’ first coast-to-coast rail network, spanning 50,000 miles and 43 states.

title: Restaurant Review: Taquería Frontera in Los Angeles
summary: At Taquería Frontera, the art of Tijuana-style tacos is on full display.

title: Class and Identity in Hilton Head: The Gullah v. Wealthy Landowners
summary: A legal fight over access to burial grounds has pitted the Gullah Geechee against wealthy landowners around Hilton Head Island.

title: How Netanyahu Played Trump for a Fool in Gaza
summary: This is the first Israeli-Palestinian war where the worst leaders on both sides are calling all the shots.

title: Trump, Juan Crow and Who Gets to Be an American
summary: The rights conferred to all by the Constitution are now subject to a sliding scale of extralegal violability depending on race, ethnicity or assumed immigration status.

title: Your Questions About Education
summary: Our reporters address reader submissions.

title: Novo Nordisk, Ozempic Drugmaker, Sees Stock Plunge 20% After Profit Warning
summary: Novo Nordisk slashed its financial forecasts as it struggled to fight off competition in the United States. It also named a new chief executive, who highlighted the “urgency” of the moment.

title: ‘Come With Me, Chuck E.’: Mouse Arrested on Credit Card Fraud Charges
summary: At a Tallahassee, Fla., Chuck E. Cheese location, a police officer told children: “Chuck E.’s busy right now.”

title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs, Awaiting Sentencing, Asks Judge to Release Him From Jail
summary: Lawyers for the music mogul, who is to be sentenced in October on prostitution charges, filed court papers saying he would sign a $50 million bond.

title: Pets, Like Dogs and Cats, Have an Environmental Cost. Here’s How to Lessen It.
summary: Some pets have wide-ranging effects on the planet. Here’s how to lessen them.
